element.name: Bray Head by Fjon, Traditional Cache (2/3)

description.p: A short climb with great views on Bray Head in Co. Wicklow

element.long-description:
The cache is located in a small tab-lock box near the summit of Bray Head.
Bray head (241m) is located at the southern end of the Bray seafront, and the walk up to the summit is very popular.
Getting there:
If you are driving, you can park at N53 11.708, W6 05.358.
You can also reach the cache by public transport (DART or Dublin Bus).
From the car park, follow the path up the hill. There are many different paths up to the summit, which one you take shouldn't matter
too much, but be aware that some can be quite steep!
You should soon reach the cross on the summit. The cache is nearby, in a place with fewer muggles, but with equally stunning views.
You may need to go through a metal gate to get there - please be sure to close it after you!.
While it is by no means a difficult hike, you should nonetheless wear approriate shoes, especially as the path can at times get a bit muddy.
And after...
If you have some time left you can also use this as a starting point for the spectacular 7km Bray-Greystones cliff walk.
There are currently also 3 caches along this route.
If you feel like some refreshment or food there are plenty of pubs on the Bray seafront. The chicken wings in The Porter House are definitely recommended!
element.encoded-hints: At waist height, under some rocks and twigs.

ul.li:
2010-05-24T19:00:00Z : Found it by EVILPETE
EVILPETE + MISSUS On holiday from England had a steady walk up to this cache on a very hot day. TN LN TFTC

2010-05-19T19:00:00Z : Found it by eclipsearch
13.16 Found on a school trip to Dublin Out: TB: MARIO
TFTC
greetings from Germany eclipsearch

2010-05-15T19:00:00Z : Found it by roybrindley
Nice spot - Thanks

2010-01-07T20:00:00Z : Found it by Cazziar
Finally getting around to logging my caches from a trip to dublin in january [:I] So a little unsure of the date... Thank you for the cache! [:)]

2009-03-14T19:58:57Z : Needs Maintenance by Kersti.com
Log book full.

2009-03-14T19:00:00Z : Write note by Kersti.com
Bug drop

2009-03-14T19:00:00Z : Found it by Kersti.com
Found with Christian and Anton. We decided to do the walk from Bray to Greystones, with the first stop being the tortuous climb up here. I wasn't happy about this idea, but a cache was reasonable incentive. Cache itself was located easily enough and is in very good condition except that the log book is totally full.
On our way out I managed to resprain my ankle. Not much chance of getting out of there except to just grit my teeth and walk on.

wpt.name: GCVKVW
wpt.desc: Bray Head by Fjon, Traditional Cache (2/3)

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Bray Head
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:short_description: A short climb with great views on Bray Head in Co. Wicklow
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
The cache is located in a small tab-lock box near the summit of Bray Head.
Bray head (241m) is located at the southern end of the Bray seafront, and the walk up to the summit is very popular.


Getting there:
If you are driving, you can park at N53 11.708, W6 05.358.
You can also reach the cache by public transport (DART or Dublin Bus).
From the car park, follow the path up the hill. There are many different paths up to the summit, which one you take shouldn't matter
too much, but be aware that some can be quite steep!
You should soon reach the cross on the summit. The cache is nearby, in a place with fewer muggles, but with equally stunning views.
You may need to go through a metal gate to get there - please be sure to close it after you!.
While it is by no means a difficult hike, you should nonetheless wear approriate shoes, especially as the path can at times get a bit muddy.

And after...
If you have some time left you can also use this as a starting point for the spectacular 7km Bray-Greystones cliff walk.
There are currently also 3 caches along this route.
If you feel like some refreshment or food there are plenty of pubs on the Bray seafront. The chicken wings in The Porter House are definitely recommended!



Additional Waypoints

CPVKVW - Parking Place
N 53° 11.708 W 006° 05.358

greetings from Germany eclipsearch
Finally getting around to logging my caches from a trip to dublin in january [:I] So a little unsure of the date... Thank you for the cache! [:)]

Found with Christian and Anton. We decided to do the walk from Bray to Greystones, with the first stop being the tortuous climb up here. I wasn't happy about this idea, but a cache was reasonable incentive. Cache itself was located easily enough and is in very good condition except that the log book is totally full.
On our way out I managed to resprain my ankle. Not much chance of getting out of there except to just grit my teeth and walk on.
